channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Hurricane Melissa Got So Intense, and a ‘Plan’ for a Third Trump Term
item.description: Plus, the longest-ever World Series game.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott Backs Disaster Recovery in Marginalized Communities
item.description: The billionaire’s $60 million donation to the Center for Disaster Philanthropy counters cuts to federal emergency assistance and diversity programs.

item.title: Melissa’s Powerful Winds Could Be Even Worse in Jamaica’s Mountains
item.description: Gusts in higher elevations could be up to 30 percent stronger, the National Hurricane Center said.

item.title: Memo From Bill Gates Warns Against Climate Alarmism
item.description: In a memo, the Microsoft co-founder warned against climate alarmism and appears to have shifted some of his views about climate change.

item.title: As Trump talks of designating antifa a foreign terrorist group, experts see danger
item.description: The designation would have, as one domestic terrorism expert told NPR, a "cascading effect across civil society, including social media organizations,...

item.title: OpenAI Restructures as For-Profit Company
item.description: The artificial intelligence company said that the nonprofit that controlled the organization would receive a $130 billion stake in the new company.

item.title: SNAP benefits set to expire this week. And, Jamaica braces for a Category 5 storm
item.description: Over 40 million Americans will soon be without federal food assistance as SNAP benefits are set to expire on Saturday. And, Jamaica braces for Hurrica...

item.title: Volunteers foster literacy by reading to children and giving them books
item.description: Volunteers with the LiTEArary society read to children who live in "book deserts" and bring them their own books.

item.title: America's immigration crackdown is disrupting the global remittance market
item.description: America's immigration crackdown might have serious financial consequences for a range of countries.

item.title: Louisiana officials waited months to warn public of whooping cough outbreak
item.description: After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. Tha...

item.title: Trump Bonds With Japan’s Leader Over Baseball and U.S. Beef
item.description: The president and Sanae Takaichi, the Japanese prime minister, traded compliments in Tokyo, but signaled no major breakthrough in resolving ongoing tr...

item.title: Trump’s Feud With Colombian Leader Threatens U.S. Antidrug Efforts
item.description: President Trump said he is cutting U.S. aid. Gustavo Petro, a leftist guerrilla turned president, has called Mr. Trump’s boat strikes murder.

item.title: As Trump Tariffs Canada, Carney Turns to Asia for Trade
item.description: Mark Carney is pitching Canada as a predictable and responsible alternative to the United States.

item.title: Live Updates: Hurricane Melissa, Stronger Than Katrina, Nears Landfall in Jamaica
item.description: The Category 5 storm’s slow pace could have devastating effects. The National Hurricane Center warned those in its path to seek shelter, saying it was...

item.title: On the Menu for Trump in Tokyo: American Rice
item.description: Rice is a point of pride in Japan, and the choice was a break from the typical diplomatic practice of showcasing local ingredients.
